data.title: All 88 Neil Diamond Movies (in Order)
data.meta_description: Get ready to dive into the world of Neil Diamond movies! This roundup features a collection of inspiring and entertaining films that showcase the legendary singerâ€™s versatility and talent. Fromâ€¦

Get ready to dive into the world of Neil Diamond movies! This roundup features a collection of inspiring and entertaining films that showcase the legendary singerâ€™s versatility and talent. From heartwarming dramas to memorable musical performances, these films will leave you humming along to Neil Diamondâ€™s timeless hits. So sit back, relax, and get ready to embark on a cinematic journey with the iconic Neil Diamond.

As an Amazonâ„¢ Associate, we earn from qualifying purchases.

1. Cactus Flower (1969)

Cactus Flower, â€œ a 1969 romantic comedy, tells the tale of a New York City dentist who devises an elaborate plan to avoid commitment by pretending to be married. With his heart set on proposing to his girlfriend, he enlists the help of his lovelorn dental assistant to portray his fictional spouse. As the hilarious plot unfolds, the characters navigate deception, love, and unconventional romance.

WUSAâ€ is a drama film set in the Deep South, where a local radio station becomes the epicenter of a right-wing conspiracy. Directed by Stuart Rosenberg and written by Robert Stone, the movie stars Paul Newman, Joanne Woodward, and Anthony Perkins.

Filmed at MGM Studios in Culver City, â€œElvis: Thatâ€™s the Way It Isâ€ takes you on a journey like never before, providing a glimpse into Elvisâ€™s life both on and off the stage.

The film is known for its famous score and its exploration of unconventional lifestyles, making it a timeless classic.
